title: 107_hr2310
content: The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for uniformed services members effective January 1, 2002, based on pay grade and years of service. The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. Monthly basic pay for commissioned officers is increased based on pay grade and years of service, with varying percentages for different pay grades ranging from O-1 to O-10. Monthly basic pay for commissioned officers increases based on pay grade and years of service, with varying percentages for different pay grades ranging from O-1 to O-10. The pay percentages for each pay grade are shown in the table provided. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service have varying pay percentages based on their pay grade, ranging from O-1 to O-3E. The percentages increase with years of service, with increments at different milestones such as over 2, over 4, over 6, over 8, over 10, over 12, over 14, and over 16 years. Commissioned officers in pay grades O-1E to O-3E have varying pay percentages based on years of service, increasing at milestones such as over 18, over 20, over 22, over 24, and over 26 years. Warrant officers' pay percentages increase based on years of service, with increments at different milestones. Warrant officers' pay percentages increase based on years of service, with increments at different milestones, ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% for various age brackets. Enlisted members' pay percentages increase based on years of service, with increments at different milestones, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for various pay grades. Enlisted members' pay percentages increase based on years of service, with increments at different milestones, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for various pay grades. The pay percentages continue to increase at different intervals, up to Over 26 years of service. Enlisted members' pay percentages increase based on years of service, with increments at different milestones, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for various pay grades, up to Over 26 years of service. The adjustment to monthly basic pay rates for uniformed services members required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, will not be made in fiscal year 2002.
